title: Authentic Chicken Tikka Masala Recipe
description: Make this authentic tikki masala from an old family recipe featuring chicken in a gently spiced tomato-based cream sauce. Serve with rice or naan.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Authentic Chicken Tikka Masala 4.7 (272) 198 Reviews 103 Photos This authentic chicken tikka masala dish follows an old family recipe. Submitted by Allrecipes Updated on December 1, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 103 103 103 103 Prep Time: 35 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings Chicken: ¼ cup plain yogurt 2 teaspoons garam masala 2 teaspoons paprika ½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon cayenne pepper ½ teaspoon ground coriander 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast - cut into 1-inch strips Sauce: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 teaspoon cumin seeds 1 large onion, chopped 2 green chile peppers, minced 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger 2 medium Roma tomatoes, diced ½ cup tomato paste ¼ cup water 1 teaspoon garam masala ½ teaspoon ground coriander ½ teaspoon ground turmeric ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste ½ cup heavy whipping cream ½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped Directions Make the chicken: Combine yogurt, garam masala, paprika, black pepper, salt, cayenne pepper, and coriander in a large bowl. Add chicken strips and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease a rimmed baking sheet. Remove chicken from marinade and place onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each piece. Bake in the preheated oven until browned and no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and set aside. Make the sauce: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook, sirring gently, until lightly toasted and aromatic, about 3 minutes. Add onion; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, 4 to 5 minutes. Add chile peppers, garlic, and ginger; continue to cook and stir until onion is browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, and water; cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes begin to break down, about 10 minutes. Add garam masala, coriander, turmeric, and salt, then stir in chicken and cream until well combined; cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Aja I Made It Print 620 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Authentic Chicken Tikka Masala 01 of 103 Photo by  Aja 02 of 103 Photo by  Frances Smith 05/09/2021 03 of 103 Photo by  gigi 03/08/2021 Loved it. 04 of 103 Photo by  Casey Waldorf 03/02/2021 05 of 103 Photo by  James 01/16/2021 This was the first time I made this dish and I did it exactly as directed. The aroma and tastes were out of this world. Maybe it could have been more spicy but I wasn't disappointed. I can't wait to try other recipes to compare to this one. I don't think I'll find any reason to do this recipe any different. 06 of 103 Photo by  Christine Dale Boland 09/08/2020 Better than our local restaurant! So fresh, so delicious. It was 105-degrees outside and I was too hot to run the oven, so I also added the cubed chicken scallapini pieces after the veggies were cooked. 07 of 103 Photo by  Cait Krueger 07/18/2020 Yum! The sauce turned out a little sweet for my taste, but the level of heat was perfect. Going to try a little more salt and garlic next time. Otherwise, really good recipe! 08 of 103 Photo by  Shawn Murphy 05/05/2020 09 of 103 Photo by  Shawn Murphy 05/05/2020 10 of 103 Photo by  Mido 04/05/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Traditional Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Indian Chicken Korma in the Slow Cooker 12 Ratings Indian-Style "Chettinad" Chicken 1 Rating Grilled Tandoori Chicken Thighs 353 Ratings Instant Pot Indian Chicken Curry 19 Ratings Lasooni Murgh (Garlic Flavored Spicy Chicken) 12 Ratings Kashmiri Lamb 56 Ratings Chicken Curry V 16 Ratings Chicken 65 4 Ratings Instant Pot® Chicken Biryani 8 Ratings Basic Indian Curry with Paneer 21 Ratings Easy Indian-Style Chicken 102 Ratings Creamy Chicken Korma 275 Ratings Aloo Gobi 69 Ratings Hyderabad Dum Biryani 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Allrecipes
instructions: Make the chicken: Combine yogurt, garam masala, paprika, black pepper, salt, cayenne pepper, and coriander in a large bowl. Add chicken strips and toss to coat. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.;Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease a rimmed baking sheet.;Remove chicken from marinade and place onto the prepared baking sheet, leaving space between each piece.;Bake in the preheated oven until browned and no longer pink inside, about 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from the oven and set aside.;Make the sauce: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and cook, sirring gently, until lightly toasted and aromatic, about 3 minutes. Add onion; cook and stir until onion begins to soften, 4 to 5 minutes. Add chile peppers, garlic, and ginger; continue to cook and stir until onion is browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, and water; cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes begin to break down, about 10 minutes.;Add garam masala, coriander, turmeric, and salt, then stir in chicken and cream until well combined; cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Garnish with cilantro. Aja
